etymology.description: 武昌 + 起义 = Wuchang + uprising.
etymology.interpretation: Names the 1911 revolt in Wuchang that ignited the Xinhai Revolution and hastened the fall of the Qing dynasty. Emphasizes place (武昌) plus the act of uprising (起义).
etymology.simplification: Only 义 was simplified (義→义) to reduce strokes and regularize the component; 武、昌、起 are unchanged.

examples.chinese: 1911年(1911年)，武昌起义爆发(武昌起義爆發)，拉开了辛亥革命的序幕(拉開了辛亥革命的序幕)。
examples.pinyin: 1911 nián, Wǔchāng Qǐyì bàofā, lā kāi le Xīnhài Gémìng de xùmù.
examples.english: In 1911, the Wuchang Uprising broke out, opening the curtain of the Xinhai Revolution.

examples.chinese: 武昌起义由新军与革命党人发动(武昌起義由新軍與革命黨人發動)，推翻了清政府在湖北的统治(推翻了清政府在湖北的統治)。
examples.pinyin: Wǔchāng Qǐyì yóu xīnjūn yǔ gémìng dǎngrén fādòng, tuīfān le Qīng zhèngfǔ zài Húběi de tǒngzhì.
examples.english: The Wuchang Uprising was launched by the New Army and revolutionaries, toppling Qing rule in Hubei.

examples.chinese: 作为辛亥革命的关键事件(作為辛亥革命的關鍵事件)，武昌起义具有深远影响(武昌起義具有深遠影響)。
examples.pinyin: Zuòwéi Xīnhài Gémìng de guānjiàn shìjiàn, Wǔchāng Qǐyì jùyǒu shēnyuǎn yǐngxiǎng.
examples.english: As a key event of the Xinhai Revolution, the Wuchang Uprising had far-reaching influence.
